meanings.definition: A neurological movement disorder characterized by involuntary muscle contractions.
meanings.sent1: Dystonia can cause muscles to contract without control.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with dystonia after observing her muscle contractions.
meanings.sent3: During the dance competition, her dystonia made her moves unpredictable.
meanings.sent4: The dystonia in his hand was like a puppeteer pulling invisible strings.
meanings.sent5: The dystonia twisted her face into a painful grimace.

meanings.definition: The abnormal muscle tone resulting from this disorder.
meanings.sent1: Her dystonia caused her muscles to have a constant tightness.
meanings.sent2: The physical therapist worked on improving his dystonia through exercises.
meanings.sent3: The dystonia in his legs made him walk like a robot.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a silent dystonia affecting everyone.
meanings.sent5: The dystonia in her neck made it difficult for her to turn her head.
